name: I Build It
description: Plans for jigs and homemade tools, as well as a ton of useful guides and tips.

name: Lost Art Press
description: My personal favorite resource for anything related to wood. Excellent books and videos, as well as a great blog.

name: The Stanley Bench Plane Page
description: A useful type study of Stanley planes, as well as a handy flowchart.

name: Sharpening Handbook
description: Instructions and diagrams for sharpening any and all types of blades.

name: Chime Design and Build
description: Everything you need to know about making a set of wind chimes.

name: 70birds
description: Free plans for birdhouses; specific to North American species.

name: Woodgears.ca
description: Engineering-focused guides and techniques; also offers plans for jigs, homemade tools, and more.

name: WoodArchivist
description: Free plans, scanned from woodworking magazines.

name: Patrick's Blood & Gore
description: The holy grail of knowledge on Stanley planes. Parts lists, rare models, frequently-missing pieces, you name it - this site probably covers it.

name: The Barn on White Run
description: Renowned craftsman and woodworker Don Williams' blog; a wealth of knowledge on woodworking, homesteading, craftsmanship, construction, and the like.

name: Pask Makes
description: Craftsman Neil Pask's channel. Homemade tools, furniture, and art. Possibly the most patient man on Earth.

name: Workshop Companion
description: Author and woodworker Nick Engler's channel. Plans, techniques, jigs, homemade finishes, and much more.

name: The Instrument Makers
description: Excellent interviews, shop tours, and information about the making of fine instruments.

name: Hyperkitten Tool Company
description: Vintage and modern woodworking/machining tools at excellent prices.

name: Just Plane Fun
description: Spare parts, mostly for vintage hand planes.

name: Tools for Working Wood
description: The type of place where you can't find a bad tool or product. A good place to buy Osmo!

name: Adrian Preda
description: An excellent craftsman, especially when it comes to making small workbenches and even smaller boxes.
